Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Acclimate \Ac*cli"mate\ (#; 277), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Acclimated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Acclimating}.] [F. acclimater; [`a] (l. ad) + climat climate. See {Climate}.] To habituate to a climate not native; to acclimatize. --J. H. Newman. [1913 Webster]
acclimate v : get used to a certain climate; "They never acclimatized in Egypt" [syn: {acclimatize}, {acclimatise}]
